intro: Microlonchus duriaei, commonly known as the Duriaei spurge, is a flowering plant native to the African continent. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its diverse species with often milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, exhibiting succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as an ornamental plant.
